com.pkry.user

Class UserModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pkry.user.UserModule

  • @Named
 @ApplicationScoped
public class UserModule
extends java.lang.Object
    User Module that comunicates with Management Module. This module receives messages from the Client.

    • Method Detail

      • Login

        public java.lang.String Login(java.lang.String login)
        Request to check if the login is correct and exists in the data base.
        Parameters:
        login - login inserted by client.
        Returns:
        Indexes of the password to insert in next step of logging process obtained from Management Module

      • insertPassword

        public java.lang.String insertPassword(java.lang.String login,
                                       java.lang.String password,
                                       java.lang.String passwordIndexes)
        Request to check if the password exists in the base (so is correct).
        Parameters:
        login - login inserted by client.
        password - password inserted by client.
        passwordIndexes - requested indexes of the password.
        Returns:
        indexes of additional information (AD) to insert in the next step of logging process obtained from Management Module.

      • insertAD

        public java.lang.String insertAD(java.lang.String login,
                                 java.lang.String password,
                                 java.lang.String passwordIndexes,
                                 java.lang.String AD,
                                 java.lang.String ADIndexes)
        Request to check if the additional information inserted by user is correct.
        Parameters:
        login - login inserted by client.
        password - password inserted by client.
        passwordIndexes - requested indexes of the password (the same as in the previous step of logging process).
        AD - AD inserted by the user.
        ADIndexes - requested indexes of the AD.
        Returns:
        if AD is correct returns sessionId.

      • getAccount

        public AccountDTO getAccount(java.lang.String sessionId,
                             java.lang.String login)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Request to obtain informations about user's account.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - ID of the current session.
        login - user's login.
        Returns:
        user's account assigned to that login.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the session expired throws SESSION EXPIRED exception.

      • getHistory

        public java.util.List<Transfer> getHistory(java.lang.String login,
                                           java.lang.String sessionId)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Request to obtain the history of previous transactions.
        Parameters:
        login - user's login.
        sessionId - ID of the current session.
        Returns:
        list of previous transactions made by client.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the session expired throws SESSION EXPIRED exception.

      • doTransfer

        public java.lang.String doTransfer(java.lang.String login,
                                   java.lang.String sessionId,
                                   java.lang.Double money,
                                   java.lang.String toAccount)
        User's request to make a money transfer to someone else's account..
        Parameters:
        login - user's login.
        sessionId - ID of the current session.
        money - amount of money to send.
        toAccount - number of destination account
        Returns:
        information whether or not the transfer has been made (if not, also sends the cause).

      • logout

        public boolean logout(java.lang.String login,
                      java.lang.String sessionId)
        Client's information that they want to logout from their bank account.
        Parameters:
        login - user's login.
        sessionId - ID of the current session.
        Returns:
        returns true if the logout was correct.
